intro: Tetracera scabricaulis, commonly known as the rough-stemmed tetracera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
